item.title: The Washington Post made an AI chatbot for questions about climate
item.description:
The Washington Post is sticking a new climate-focused AI chatbot inside its homepage, app, and articles. The experimental tool, called Climate Answers, will use the outlet’s breadth of reporting to answer questions about climate change, the environment, sustainable energy, and more.

Some of the questions you can ask the chatbot include things like, “Should I get solar panels for my home?” or “Where in the US are sea levels rising the fastest?” Much like the other AI chatbots we’ve seen, it will then serve up a summary using the information it’s been trained on. In this case, Climate Answers uses the articles within The Washington Post’s climate section — as far back as the section’s launch in 2016 — to answer questions.

Continue reading…
item.dc:creator: Emma Roth

item.title: Uber is cutting fares before Australia’s minimum gig work standards take effect, drivers say
item.description:
Ride-hail giant is lowering the starting point for negotiations under the closing loopholes regime, one driver claims

  • Get our morning and afternoon news emails, free app or daily news podcast

Uber drivers say looming cuts to fares will squeeze them even more in a cost-of-living crisis, arguing the ride-hailing giant is reducing what they are paid before new standards under the government’s closing loopholes legislation are determined.

Last week, Uber told drivers that rider fares would be cut from 7 August. The company has not told drivers the exact amount, but it is understood it would be an average of less than 5%.

Sign up for Guardian Australia’s free morning and afternoon email newsletters for your daily news roundup

item.title: ASML CEO says world needs the legacy chips China is producing, Handelsblatt reports
Pre-Prime Day Roomba deals are finally trickling in
item.description: More Roombas should go on sale before Prime Day starts on July 16, but for now, snag the Roomba Combo i3+ for almost 50% off.

item.title: You should probably wait to get a Fire Tablet until Prime Day starts, but there are a few on sale ahead of the big event
item.description: As of July 5, a few of Amazon's Fire Tablets are on sale ahead of Prime Day, although we think the deals will be much better when the event officially starts. Here are the best deals so far, including up to $95 off the Fire HD 10.

item.title: Prime Day Chromebook deals are already going strong — check out our top picks
item.description: As of July 3, a good amount of Chromebooks from various brands are on sale ahead of Amazon Prime Day. Check out our favorite discounts so far.

item.title: Get the M1 MacBook Air for an all-time low price of $649 at Walmart
item.description: As of July 9, the M1 MacBook Air is down to $649 on Walmart, which is an all-time low price on Apple's affordable MacBook.

item.title: Amazon deal of the day: The brand-new Echo Spot is already on sale for Prime members
item.description: Amazon's best deals of the day on July 9 include the Echo Spot, JBL Tune 230NC earbuds, Sony Bluetooth speaker, Fire Max 11 tablet, and Shark SpeedStyle.

item.title: How to tint your apps with iOS 18
item.description: Apple's iOS 18 has some exciting new updates, including more custom options for your home screen.

item.title: Prime Day Echo deals: the Amazon smart home devices are falling to record-low prices
item.description: The best early Prime Day Echo deals include the Echo Spot's first discount and some record-low prices on Amazon's Echo Frames smart glasses.

item.title: Robot vacuum deals at Amazon are booming pre-Prime Day
item.description: While Prime Day doesn't start until July 16, Amazon already has robot vacuums on sale. Get 50% off a self-emptying Shark or self-cleaning Eufy.

item.title: A few popular MacBook models are already discounted ahead of Prime Day
item.description: As of July 2, a few of our favorite MacBook models are on sale ahead of this year's summer Prime Day event. Check out our top deals and start saving early.

item.title: Some invite-only deals are live ahead of Prime Day 2024
item.description: Amazon officially announced that Prime Day returns on July 16 and 17, and for the second year in a row, they're bringing back invite-only deals. Here's what's available so far, plus everything else you need to know.

item.title: All AirPods just dropped to their lowest price ever ahead of Prime Day
item.description: Prime Day 2024 is a week away, but the best deal on AirPods has arrived. Catch AirPods, AirPods Pro, and AirPods Max for their lowest prices ever.

item.title: The brand-new Amazon Echo Spot is 44% off for Prime members
item.description: The Amazon Echo Spot is on sale for just $44.99 for Prime members, down from the normal price of $79.99. That's a 44% discount.
